subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [The Word Became Flesh] In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. He was with God in the beginning. The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth. - John 1:1-2, 14
reflection: "The Word became flesh" By doing so, Jesus became The perfect teacher The perfect example ~ The perfect sacrifice "The only Son of the Father" ~ Means Jesus is God's only and unique Son The emphases is on unique. Jesus is one of a kind and enjoys a relationship with God. He is unlike believers, who are called "children of God." When Jesus was born, God became man. He was not part man and part God; He was completely human and completely divine. (Colossians 2:9). Before Christ came, people could only know God partially. After Christ came, people could know God fully because He became visible and tangible in Christ. Christ is the perfect expression of God in human form. The two most common errors people make about Jesus Is to minimize His humanity or minimize His divinity. Remember Jesus is both God and man.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, I thank you for making God really known, and for becoming Lord of my life. Amen.
original_content:
11/02/2010~~~food for thought~~~PERFECT IN EVERY WAY

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"[The Word Became Flesh] In the beginning was the Word, 
and the Word was with God, and the Word was God. He was 
with God in the beginning. The Word became flesh and made 
his dwelling among us. We have seen his glory, the glory of the 
one and only Son, who came from the Father, full of grace and truth." John 1:1-2, 14 

Our Lesson for Today:
"The Word became flesh" By doing so, Jesus became The perfect teacher
The perfect example ~ The perfect sacrifice

"The only Son of the Father" ~ Means Jesus is God's only and unique Son
The emphases is on unique. Jesus is one of a kind and enjoys a relationship
with God. He is unlike believers, who are called "children of God."

When Jesus was born, God became man. He was not part man and part God;
He was completely human and completely divine. (Col. 2:9). Before Christ came,
people could only know God partially. After Christ came, people could know God 
fully because He became visible and tangible in Christ.

Christ is the perfect expression of God in human form. The two most common 
errors people make about Jesus Is to minimize His humanity or minimize His divinity.
Remember Jesus is both God and man.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, I thank you for making God really known,
and for becoming Lord of my life. Amen. 

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [God's Final Word: His Son] In the past God spoke to our ancestors through the prophets at many times and in various ways, but in these last days he has spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of all things, and through whom also he made the universe. - Hebrews 1:1-2
reflection: God used many approaches to send His message to people in O. T. times. He spoke to Isaiah in visions (Isaiah 6), to Jacob in a dream (Genesis 28:10-22) and to Abraham and Moses personally (Genesis 18; Exo. 31:8). Jewish people familiar with these stories would not have found it hard to believe that God was still revealing His will, but it was astonishing for them to think that God had revealed Himself by speaking through His Son, Jesus Christ. Let us not forget that Jesus is the fulfillment and culmination of God's revelation through the centuries. When we know Him, we have all we need to be saved from our sin and to have a perfect relationship with God. Jesus is not only the exact representation of God, but is God Himself.
prayer: Dear Lord I am so thankful that You chose to make Yourself known to man kind through Your Son Jesus Christ. I pray that all who realize a personal relationship with You. Amen
original_content:
12/03/201o~~~food for thought~~~THE CULMINATION OF GOD HIMSELF

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"[God's Final Word: His Son] In the past God spoke to our ancestors 
through the prophets at many times and in various ways, but in these 
last days he has spoken to us by his Son, whom he appointed heir of 
all things, and through whom also he made the universe." - Hebrews 1:1-2 

Our Lesson for Today:
God used many approaches to send His message to people in O.T. times.
He spoke to Isaiah in visions (Isa. 6), to Jacob in a dream (Gen. 28:10-22)
and to Abraham and Moses personally (Gen. 18; Exo. 31:8).

Jewish people familiar with these stories would not have found it hard to believe
that God was still revealing His will, but it was astonishing for them to think that
God had revealed Himself by speaking through His Son, Jesus Christ.

Let us not forget that Jesus is the fulfillment and culmination of God's revelation
through the centuries. When we know Him , we have all we need to be saved from 
our sin and to have a perfect relationship with God.

Jesus is not only the exact representation of God, but is God Himself.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord I am so thankful that You chose to make Yourself
known to man kind through Your Son Jesus Christ. I pray that
all who realize a personal relationship with You. Amen


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Then Jesus declared, I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never go hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty. - John 6:35
reflection: We eat bread to satisfy our physical hunger and to sustain physical life. We can satisfy our spiritual life only by a right relationship with Jesus Christ. No wonder He called Himself the bread of life. But bread must be eaten to sustain life and Christ must be invited into our daily walk to sustain spiritual life. Those who put their faith in Christ will be resurrect from physical death to eternal life with God when Christ comes again. (I Corinthians 15:52) (I Thessalonians 4:16)
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, help me make a conscious decision to follow You each day. Amen.

"Then Jesus declared, "I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never go hungry, 
and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty." - John 6:35

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [Dispute Over Jesus' Testimony] When Jesus spoke again to the people, he said, I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness, but will have the light of life. - John 8:12
reflection: Jesus call Himself the light of the world. The pillar of fire that went before the Hebrew people represented God's presence, protection and guidance. Jesus brings God's presence, protection and guidance. ~ Yes He truly is the light of our world. What does it mean to follow Christ? As a soldier follows his captain, so we should follow Christ, our commander. As a slave follows his master, so we should follow Christ, or Lord. As we follow the advice of a trusted counselor, so we should follow Jesus' commands to us in the Scripture. As we follow the laws of the nation. we should follow the laws of the Kingdom of Heaven.
prayer: Dear Lord I pray that I would recognize Your guiding light and follow it. Amen.

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"[Dispute Over Jesus' Testimony] When Jesus spoke again to the people, 
he said, "I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk 
in darkness, but will have the light of life."" - John 8:12 

Our Lesson for Today:
Jesus call Himself the light of the world. The pillar of fire that went before the 
Hebrew people represented God's presence, protection and guidance. Jesus
brings God's presence, protection and guidance. ~ Yes He truly is the light of
our world.

What does it mean to follow Christ? As a soldier follows his captain, so we should

Christ, or Lord.

As we follow the advice of a trusted counselor, so we should follow Jesus' commands 
to us in the Scripture. As we follow the laws of the nation. we should follow the laws of

light and follow it. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Therefore Jesus said again, Very truly I tell you, I am the gate for the sheep. I am the gate; whoever enters through me will be saved. They will come in and go out, and find pasture. The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have come that they may have life, and have it to the full. - John 10:7, 9-10
reflection: In the sheepfold, the shepherd functions as a gate, letting the sheep in and protecting nthem. Jesus is the gate to God's salvation for us. He offers access to safety and security. Christ is our protector. Some people resent that Jesus is the gate, the only way of access to God. In contrast to the thief who takes life, Jesus gives life. The life He gives right now is abundantly rich and full. It is eternal, yet begins immediately. Life in Christ is lived on a higher plane because of His overflowing of forgiveness, love, and guidance. Have you taken Christ's offer of life?
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for your overflowing forgiveness love, and guidance. Amen.
original_content:
12/06/2010~~~food for thought~~~GATE TO LIFE

Bile Verse for Today:
"Therefore Jesus said again, "Very truly I tell you, I am the gate for the sheep. 
I am the gate; whoever enters through me will be saved. They will come in and 
go out, and find pasture. The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy; I have 
come that they may have life, and have it to the full." - John 10:7, 9-10 

Thought for Today:
In the sheepfold, the shepherd functions as a gate, letting the sheep in and protecting
them. Jesus is the gate to God's salvation for us. He offers access to safety and security.
Christ is our protector. Some people resent that Jesus is the gate, the only way of access 
to God.

In contrast to the thief who takes life, Jesus gives life. The life He gives right now is 
abundantly rich and full. It is eternal, yet begins immediately. Life in Christ is lived on
a higher plane because of His overflowing of forgiveness, love, and guidance.

Have you taken Christ's offer of life?

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank You for your overflowing forgiveness
love, and guidance . Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am the good shepherd; I know my sheep and my sheep know mejust as the Father knows me and I know the Fatherland I lay down my life for the sheep. - John 10:14-15
reflection: In the Old Testament, know means more than knowledge. It implies an intimate relationship. The communion between God the Father and God the Son is the core of their relationship. For anyone else to know God, God must reveal Himself to that person, by the Son's choice. How fortunate we are that Jesus clearly revealed God to us, as well as His truth and how we can know Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for Your intimate love, a love that is so special that you sent Your one and only Son to be a sacrifice for my sins. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus said to her, I am the resurrection and the life. The one who believes in me will live, even though they die;  - John 11:25
reflection: Let us never forget that Jesus has power over life and death as well as the power to forgive sins. This is because He is the creator of life (John 14:6). He who is life can surely restore life. Whoever believes in Christ has a spiritual life that death cannot conquer or diminish in any way. When we come to realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us really is, how can we not commit our lives to Him? ? ? To those of us who believe, what a wonderful assurance and certainty we have: I will live again, and you will too (John 14:19b).
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to remain faithful until Your return, so that I may inherit eternal life. Amen.
original_content:
12/08/2010~~~food for thought~~~LIFE AFTER DEATH

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Jesus said to her, "I am the resurrection and the life. 
The one who believes in me will live, even though they die;" - John 11:25 

Our Lesson for Today:
Let us never forget that Jesus has power over life and death as well as the power
to forgive sins. This is because He is the creator of life (Jn. 14:6). He who is life
can surely restore life.

Whoever believes in Christ has a spiritual life that death cannot conquer or diminish
in any way. When we come to realize His power and how wonderful His offer to us
really is, how can we not commit our lives to Him? ? ?

To those of us who believe, what a wonderful assurance and certainty we have:
"I will live again, and you will too" (Jn. 14:19b).

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord,Help me to remain faithful until Your return,
so that I may inherit eternal life. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Jesus answered, "I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me." - John 14:6
reflection: Where have you seen this before? ? ? Well I thought I had better remind you all, that this is one of the most basic and important passages in Scripture. How can we know the way to God? ~ Only through Jesus. Jesus is the way because He is both God and man. By uniting our lives with His, we are united with God. Trust Jesus to take you to the Father, and all the benefits of being God's child will be yours. Yes, as the way, Jesus is our path to the Father. as the truth, He is the reality of all God's promises. As the life, He joins His divine life to ours, both now and for eternally.
prayer: Thank you, God, for providing a sure way to get to You. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I am the true vine, and My Father is the gardener. - John 15:1
reflection: Christ is the vine, and God is the gardener who cares for the branches to make them fruitful. ~ The branches are all those who claim to be followers of Christ. The fruitful branches are true believers who by their living union with Christ produce much fruit. ~ BUT those who turn back from following Christ after making a superficial commitment ~ will be separated from the vine. Unproductive followers are as good as dead and will be cut off and tossed aside.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, Help me be a more productive branch for You. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 5 But if our unrighteousness brings out God's righteousness more clearly, what shall we say? That God is unjust in bringing his wrath on us? (I am using a human argument. ) 6 Certainly not! If that were so, how could God judge the world? 7 Someone might argue, "If my falsehood enhances God's truthfulness and so increases his glory, why am I still condemned as a sinner?" 8 Why not say-as some slanderously claim that we say-"Let us do evil that good may result"? Their condemnation is just! - Romans 3:5-8
reflection: Some think they don't have to worry about sin because: (1) It's God's Job to forgive; (2) God is so loving He won't judge us; (3) Sin is not so bad ~ it teaches us valuable lessons; or (4) We need to stay in touch with the culture around us. Oh how easy it is for some to take God's grace for granted. But God can not overlook sin. No matter how many excuses they make, sinners will have to answer to God for their sin.
prayer: Help me to recognize my sins and bring them to You. Help me live a more righteous life, so as not to cause others to stumble. Amen.
original_content:
Sundays devotional
10/12/2010~~~food for thought~~~HE IS HOLY AND JUST

Our Bible Verse for Today:
5 But if our unrighteousness brings out God's righteousness more clearly, what shall we say? 
That God is unjust in bringing his wrath on us? (I am using a human argument.) 6 Certainly not! 
If that were so, how could God judge the world? 7 Someone might argue, "If my falsehood enhances 
God's truthfulness and so increases his glory, why am I still condemned as a sinner?" 
8 Why not say-as some slanderously claim that we say-"Let us do evil that good may result"? 
Their condemnation is just! Ro. 3:5-8

Our Lesson for Today:
Some think they don't have to worry about sin because:
(1) It's God's Job to forgive;
(2) God is so loving He won't judge us;
(3) Sin is not so bad ~ it teaches us valuable lessons; or
(4) We need to stay in touch with the culture around us.

Oh how easy it is for some to take God's grace for granted.
But God can not overlook sin. No matter how many excuses 
they make, sinners will have to answer to God for their sin.

Prayer Suggestion:
Help me to recognize my sins and bring them to You.
Help me live a more righteous life, so as not to cause
others to stumble. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But when the set time had fully come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under the law, to redeem those under the law, that we might receive adoption to sonship. - Galatians 4:4-5
reflection: God rested on the seventh day, not because He was tired, but to indicate the completion of creation. ~ The world was perfect, and God was well pleased with it. This rest is a foretaste of our eternal joy when creation will be renewed and restored, every mark of sin will be removed, and the world will be made perfect again. Our Sabbath-rest in Christ begins when we trust Him to complete His good and perfect work in us. What keeps us from God's ultimate blessings is, ungrateful hearts (Psalms 95:2), not worshiping or submitting to Him (Psalms 95:6), hoarding our hearts (Psalms 95:8), testing God because of stubborn doubts (Psalms 95:9). Lets reject the glamour of sin and anything else that would lead us away from God.
prayer: Dear Lord, You know my heart take it and wash it white as snow. Amen.
original_content:
12/13/2010~~~food for thought~~~TRUSTING HIM COMPLETELY

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"But when the set time had fully come, God sent his Son, born of a woman, born under 
the law, to redeem those under the law, that we might receive adoption to sonship." 
- Galatians 4:4-5

Our Lesson for Today:
God rested on the seventh day, not because He was tired, but to indicate the
completion of creation. ~ The world was perfect, and God was well pleased
with it.

This rest is a foretaste of our eternal joy when creation will be renewed and restored,
every mark of sin will be removed, and the world will be made perfect again.

Our Sabbath-rest in Christ begins when we trust Him to complete His good and 
perfect work in us.

What keeps us from God's ultimate blessings is, ungrateful hearts (Ps. 95:2), 
not worshiping or submitting to Him (Ps. 95:6), harding our hearts (Ps. 95:8),
testing God because of stubborn doubts (Ps. 95:9). Lets reject the glamour
of sin and anything else that would lead us away from God.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, You know my heart take it and wash it white
as snow... Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: When he had called together all the people's chief priests and teachers of the law, he asked them where the Messiah was to be born. In Bethlehem in Judea, they replied, for this is what the prophet has written: But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for out of you will come a ruler who will shepherd my people Israel. - Matthew 2:4-6
reflection: The leading priests and teachers of religious law were well aware of Micah 5:2 and other prophecies about the Messiah. The astrologers' news trouble Herod because he knew that the Jewish people expected the Messiah to come soon we see this in (Luke 3:15). Most of the Jews expected the Messiah to be a great military and political deliverer, Like Alexander the Great. Herod's counselors would have told Herod this. No wonder this ruthless man took no chances and ordered all the Baby boys of Bethlehem killed. The promised eternal King in David's line, who came to live as a man, had been alive forever ~ whose origin was from the distant past, though was eternal, entered human history as the man, Jesus of Nazareth.
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You that You were will to take on human form even though You were eternal and were willing to die for my sins. Amen.
original_content:
12/14/2010~~~food for thought~~~SHEPHERD OF GOD'S PEOPLE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"When he had called together all the people's chief priests and teachers of the law, 
he asked them where the Messiah was to be born. "In Bethlehem in Judea," they replied, 
"for this is what the prophet has written: "'But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah, 
are by no means least among the rulers of Judah; for out of you will come a ruler who will 
shepherd my people Israel.'"" - Matthew 2:4-6 

Our Lesson for Today:
The leading priests and teachers of religious law were well aware of Micah 5:2
and other prophecies about the Messiah. The astrologers' news trouble Herod
because he knew that the Jewish people expected the Messiah to come soon
we see this in (Lk 3:15).

Most of the Jews expected the Messiah to be a great military and political deliverer,
Like Alexander the Great. Herod's counselors would have told Herod this. No wonder
this ruthless man took no chances and ordered all the Baby boys of Bethlehem killed.

The promised eternal King in David's line, who came to live as a man, had been
alive forever ~ whose origin was from the distant past, though was eternal, entered 
human history as the man, Jesus of Nazareth.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You that You were will to take on
human form even though You were eternal and were willing
to die for my sins. Amen. 
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [The Birth of Jesus Foretold] In the sixth month of Elizabeth's pregnancy, God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee, to a virgin pledged to be married to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin's name was Mary. The angel went to her and said, Greetings, you who are highly favored! The Lord is with you. - Luke 1:26-28
reflection: Each year we hear the story how God chose Mary who was a young virgin. Some stories have it that she was somewhere between 16 and 18. Yes she was young, poor, and we have to mention female ~ all the characteristics that, to the people of her day, would make her seem unusable by God' for any major task. But God chose Mary for one of the most important acts of obedience He has ever demanded of anyone. You may feel that your ability, experience, or education makes you an unlikely candidate for God's service. But never limit or question God's choices. Remember all thing are possible with God, He can use anyone if you trust Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, I do confess that there are times that I feel inadequate and so I don't always do the things You would have me do. Help me to grow in faith so that I would be obedient to Your wishes. Amen.
original_content:
12/15/2010~~~food for thought~~~ALL THINGS ARE POSSIBLE WITH GOD.

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"[The Birth of Jesus Foretold] In the sixth month of Elizabeth's pregnancy, 
God sent the angel Gabriel to Nazareth, a town in Galilee, to a virgin pledged 
to be married to a man named Joseph, a descendant of David. The virgin's name 
was Mary. The angel went to her and said, "Greetings, you who are highly favored! 
The Lord is with you."" - Luke 1:26-28 

Our Lesson for Today:
Each year we hear the story how God chose Mary who was a young virgin.
Some stories have it that she was somewhere between 16 and 18. 

Yes she was young, poor, and we have to mention female ~ all the 
characteristics that, to the people of her day, would make her seem 
unusable by God' for any major task.

But God chose Mary for one of the most important acts of obedience
He has ever demanded of anyone. You may feel that your ability,
experience, or education makes you an unlikely candidate for God's
service.

But never limit or question God's choices. Remember all thing 
are possible with God, He can use anyone if you trust Him.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I do confess that there are times that I feel inadequate
and so I don't always do the things You would have me do. Help 
me to grow in faith so that I would be obedient to Your wishes. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But the angel said to her, Do not be afraid, Mary; you have found favor with God. You will conceive and give birth to a son, and you are to call him Jesus. He will be great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the throne of his father David, and he will reign over Jacob's descendants forever; his kingdom will never end. - Luke 1:30-33
reflection: God's favor does not automatically bring instant success or fame. Think about what I just said ~ His blessing on Mary, the honor of being the mother of the Messiah would lead to much pain: her peers would ridicule her; her finance' would come close to leaving her; Her son would be rejected and murdered. But through her Son would come the worlds only hope, and this is why Mary has been praised by countless generations. Her submission was part of God's plan to bring our salvation. If sorrow weighs you down and dims your hope, think of Mary and wait patiently for God to finish working out His plan.
prayer: Dear Lord, I always feel bad while reading about the pain and sorrow Mary had to endure, but I am thankful for the out come. I thank you for the lesson being taught here. Amen.
original_content:
12/16/2010~~~food for thought~~~WAIT PATIENTLY GOD HAS A PLAN

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"But the angel said to her, "Do not be afraid, Mary; you have found favor with God. 
You will conceive and give birth to a son, and you are to call him Jesus. He will be 
great and will be called the Son of the Most High. The Lord God will give him the 
throne of his father David, and he will reign over Jacob's descendants forever; his 
kingdom will never end."" - Luke 1:30-33 

Our Lesson for Today:
God's favor does not automatically bring instant success or fame.

Think about what I just said ~ His blessing on Mary, the honor of being
the mother of the Messiah would lead to much pain: her peers would 
ridicule her; her finance' would come close to leaving her; Her son would 
be rejected and murdered.

But through her Son would come the worlds only hope, and this is why
Mary has been praised by countless generations. Her submission was
part of God's plan to bring our salvation.

If sorrow weighs you down and dims your hope, think of Mary and wait
patiently for God to finish working out His plan.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I always feel bad while reading about the pain and sorrow 
Mary had to endure, but I am thankful for the out come. I thank you for
the lesson being taught here.Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: [Mary's Song] And Mary said: My soul glorifies the Lord and my spirit rejoices in God my Savior, for the Mighty One has done great things for me - holy is his name. - Luke 1:46-47
reflection: Mary was merely doing what we are all called to do in (Psalms 34:2, 3) 2 I will glory in the LORD; let the afflicted hear and rejoice. 3 Glorify the LORD with me; let us exalt his name together I think we often tend to admire three thing about others: wisdom, power (might), and riches. But God puts a higher priority on knowing Him personally and living a life that reflects His justice and righteousness. What do you want people to admire most about you.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that my life would exemplify a life that reflects Your justice and righteousness. Amen.
original_content:
12?17/2010~~~food for thought~~~DOING WHAT PLEASES GOD

"[Mary's Song] And Mary said: "My soul glorifies the Lord and my spirit rejoices 
in God my Savior, for the Mighty One has done great things for me- holy is his name." Luke 1:46-47, 49 

Our Lesson for Today:
Mary was merely doing what we are all called to do in (Ps. 34:2, 3)
2 I will glory in the LORD; let the afflicted hear and rejoice. 
3 Glorify the LORD with me; let us exalt his name together

I think we often tend to admire three thing about others: wisdom, power (might), and riches. 
But God puts a higher priority on knowing Him personally and living a life that reflects 
His justice and righteousness.

What do you want people to admire most about you.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I pray that my life would exemplify a
life that reflects Your justice and righteousness. Amen.
Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But after he had considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit. She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins.  - Matthew 1:20-21
reflection: The angel declared to Joseph that Mary's child was conceived by the Holy Spirit and that it would be a son. This by the way reveals an important truth about Jesus He is both God and human. The infinite, unlimited God took on the limitations of humanity so He could live and die for the salvation of all who would believe in Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for saving me from the consequences of sin. Amen.
original_content:
12/18/2010~~~food for thought~~~

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"But after he had considered this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, 
"Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is 
conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit. She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the 
name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins."" - Matthew 1:20-21 

Our Lesson for Today:
The angel declared to Joseph that Mary's child was conceived by the Holy Spirit
and that it would be a son. This by the way reveals an important truth about Jesus He is both God and human.

The infinite, unlimited God took on the limitations of humanity so He could live and 
die for the salvation of all who would believe in Him.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank you for saving me from the consequences of sin. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come to his people and redeemed them. He has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of his servant David (as he said through his holy prophets of long ago), - Luke 1:68-70
reflection: God's protection of His people is limitless and can take many forms. In (Psalms 18:2-3) David characterizes God's care with five military symbols: God is like (1) a rock that can't be moved by any who would harm us, (2) a fortress or place of safety where the enemy can't follow, (3) a shield that comes between us and harm, (4) strength of salvation, a symbol of right and power, (5) a stronghold high above our enemies. So if you need protection, look to God. Our Prayer for Today: Dear Lord, I thank You for Your unlimited love and protection. Amen.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for Your unlimited love and protection. Amen.
original_content:
12/19/2010~~~food for thought~~~GOD'S LOVE AND MERCY ARE LIMITLESS

Our Bible Verse for Today:
""Praise be to the Lord, the God of Israel, because he has come to his people 
and redeemed them. He has raised up a horn of salvation for us in the house of 
his servant David (as he said through his holy prophets of long ago)," - Luke 1:68-70 

Our Lesson for Today:
God's protection of His people is limitless and can take many forms...

In (Ps. 18:2-3) David characterizes God's care with five military symbols:
God is like (1) a rock that can't be moved by any who would harm us,
(2) a fortress or place of safety where the enemy can't follow,
(3) a shield that comes between us and harm,
(4) strength of salvation, a symbol of right and power,
(5) a stronghold high above our enemies.

So if you need protection, look to God.

Our Prayer for Today:
Dear Lord, I thank You for Your unlimited love
and protection. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And you, my child, will be called a prophet of the Most High; for you will go on before the Lord to prepare the way for him, to give his people the knowledge of salvation through the forgiveness of their sins, because of the tender mercy of our God, by which the rising sun will come to us from heaven - Luke 1:76-78
reflection: Zechariah had just recalled hundreds of years of God's sovereign work in history, beginning with Abraham and going on into eternity. Then, in tender contrast, he personalized the story. His son had been chosen for a key role in the drama of the ages. Although God has unlimited power, He chooses to work through frail humans who begin as helpless babies. ~ Don't minimize what God can do through those who are faithful to Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to recognize Your sovereign power, that I might be lead by You. Amen.

12/20/2010~~~food for thought~~~ALWAYS TRUST HIS SOVEREIGN POWER

Bible Verse for Today:
"And you, my child, will be called a prophet of the Most High; 
for you will go on before the Lord to prepare the way for him, 
to give his people the knowledge of salvation through the 
forgiveness of their sins, because of the tender mercy of our 
God, by which the rising sun will come to us from heaven" - Luke 1:76-78 

Lesson for Today:
Zechariah had just recalled hundreds of years of God's sovereign work
in history, beginning with Abraham and going on into eternity. Then, in
tender contrast, he personalized the story. His son had been chosen
for a key role in the drama of the ages.

Although God has unlimited power, He chooses to work through frail
humans who begin as helpless babies. ~ Don't minimize what God can
do through those who are faithful to Him.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, help me to recognize Your sovereign power, that
I might be lead by You.Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: A shoot will come up from the stump of Jesse; from his roots a Branch will bear fruit. 2 The Spirit of the LORD will rest on him- the Spirit of wisdom and of understanding, the Spirit of counsel and of might, the Spirit of the knowledge and fear of the LORD3 and he will delight in the fear of the LORD. He will not judge by what he sees with his eyes, or decide by what he hears with his ears; 4 but with righteousness he will judge the needy, with justice he will give decisions for the poor of the earth. He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth; with the breath of his lips he will slay the wicked. 5 Righteousness will be his belt and faithfulness the sash around his waist. - Isaiah 11:1
reflection: God will judge with fairness and truth. Oh how we long for fair treatment from others ~ BUT do we give it? ~ We hate those who base their judgments on appearance, false evidence or hearsay ~ BUT are we quick to judge others using those standards. Only Christ can be the perfectly fair judge. Only as He governs our hearts can we learn to be as fair in our treatment of others as we expect others to be toward us. The Messiah is the fulfillment of God's promise that a descendant of David would rule forever.
prayer: Dear Lord, teach me to treat others as I would have them tread me. Amen.
original_content:
12/21/2010~~~food for thought~~~FAIR JUDGMENT

Bible verse for Today:

Isaiah 11
1 A shoot will come up from the stump of Jesse; from his roots a Branch will bear fruit. 
2 The Spirit of the LORD will rest on him- the Spirit of wisdom and of understanding, 
the Spirit of counsel and of might, the Spirit of the knowledge and fear of the LORD3 and he will delight in the fear of the LORD. He will not judge by what he sees with his eyes, 
or decide by what he hears with his ears; 
4 but with righteousness he will judge the needy, with justice he will give decisions for the 
poor of the earth. He will strike the earth with the rod of his mouth; with the breath of his 
lips he will slay the wicked. 
5 Righteousness will be his belt and faithfulness the sash around his waist.

Lesson for Today:
God will judge with fairness and truth. Oh how we long for fair treatment from others ~
BUT do we give it? ~ We hate those who base their judgments on appearance, false
evidence or hearsay ~ BUT are we quick to judge others using those standards.

Only Christ can be the perfectly fair judge. Only as He governs our hearts can we learn 
to be as fair in our treatment of others as we expect others to be toward us.

The Messiah is the fulfillment of God's promise that a descendent of David would rule
forever.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, teach me to treat others as I would have them tread me. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather
The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: While they were there, the time came for the baby to be born, and she gave birth to her firstborn, a son. She wrapped him in cloths and placed him in a manger, because there was no guest room available for them. - Luke 2:6-7
reflection: Even though our first picture of Jesus is as a baby in a manger, it must not be our last. The Christ Child in the manger has been the subject of a beautiful Christmas scene, but we should not leave Him there. This tiny, helpless baby lived an amazing life, died for us, ascended to heaven, and will come back to earth as king of kings. Christ will rule the world, and judge all people according to their decisions about Him. Do you still picture Jesus as a baby in a manger ~ is He your Lord? Make sure you don't underestimate Jesus. Let Him grow up in your life.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: And there were shepherds living out in the fields nearby, keeping watch over their flocks at night. An angel of the Lord appeared to them, and the glory of the Lord shone around them, and they were terrified. But the angel said to them, Do not be afraid. I bring you good news that will cause great joy for all the people. Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is the Messiah, the Lord. - Luke 2:8-11
reflection: What a birth announcement! The shepherds were terrified, but their fear turned to joy as the angels announced the Messiah's birth. First the Shepherds ran to see the baby; then they ran to spread the Word. Jesus is your Messiah, your Savior. Do you look forward to meeting Him in prayer and His Word each day? Have you discovered a Lord so wonderful that you can't help sharing your joy with your friends? Be sure to read the Christmas story again this year. I never gets old. Luke 2:1-20
prayer: Dear Lord, Help me to be more like the shepherd of old, eager to meet the Savior and then eager to spread the Word. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me. Jn: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is the Messiah, the Lord. This will be a sign to you: You will find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger. Suddenly a great company of the heavenly host appeared with the angel, praising God and saying, Glory to God in the highest heaven, and on earth peace to those on whom his favor rests. - Luke 2:11-14
reflection: Some of the Jews were waiting for a savior to deliver them from Roman rule, others hoped the Christ (Messiah) would deliver them from physical ailments. BUT Jesus, while healing their illnesses and establishing a spiritual Kingdom, delivered them from sin. His work is more far-reaching than anyone can imagine. Christ paid the price for sin and opened the way to peace with God. He offers us more than temporary political or physical changes - He offers us new hearts that will last for eternity. In the highest.  Refers to praise in the heavenly realms, where God and the angels live. on earth peace.  Emphasizes not human good will but God's grace and the peace it brings us.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for the new heart that was made possible to me through Christ's coming to earth. Amen.
original_content:
12/24/2010~~~food for thought~~~TRUE PEACE COMES ONLY BY GOD'S GRACE

Our Bible Verse for Today:
"Today in the town of David a Savior has been born to you; he is the Messiah, the Lord. 
This will be a sign to you: You will find a baby wrapped in cloths and lying in a manger." 
Suddenly a great company of the heavenly host appeared with the angel, praising God and 
saying, "Glory to God in the highest heaven, and on earth peace to those on whom his favor 
rests."" - Luke 2:11-14

Our Lesson for Today:
Some of the Jews were waiting for a savior to deliver them from Roman rule, 
others hoped the Christ (Messiah) would deliver them from physical ailments. 
BUT Jesus, while healing their illnesses and establishing a spiritual Kingdom, 
delivered them from sin.

His work is more far-reaching than anyone can imagine. Christ paid the price for 
sin and opened the way to peace with God. He offers us more than temporary
political or physical changes - He offers us new hearts that will last for eternity.

"In the highest." Refers to praise in the heavenly realms, where God and the 
angels live. "on earth peace." Emphasizes not human good will but God's grace 
and the peace it brings us.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank you for the new heart that was made possible
to me through Christ's coming to earth. Amen.


Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: So they hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger. When they had seen him, they spread the word concerning what had been told them about this child, and all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds said to them. But Mary treasured up all these things and pondered them in her heart. The shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, which were just as they had been told. - Luke 2:16-20
reflection: Have you caught the bug? I hope you have! ! ! ~ You are probably thinking, Has this guy gone over the edge? Well let me explain: The Good News about Jesus is contagious. The shepherds didn't waste any time, as soon as the angels left, they hurried off to find Mary and the baby. They were interested in seeing for themselves what they had been told. As soon as they had saw the Christ child, they immediately broadcast what they had heard and seen. There is nothing wrong with checking out things you have been told. Remember Christianity does not say, Close your eyes and believe, but rather, Check it out yourself. The Bible encourages us to investigate its claims thoroughly (John 1:46; 21:24 Acts 17:11, 12), because your conclusion about Jesus is a life-and-death matter.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for the birth of a Savior, who was willing to come down from Your Kingdom to pay the price for my sins. Amen.
original_content:
12/25/2010~~~food for thought~~~SPREAD THE WORD

So they hurried off and found Mary and Joseph, and the baby, who was lying in the manger. 
When they had seen him, they spread the word concerning what had been told them about 
this child, and all who heard it were amazed at what the shepherds said to them. But Mary 
treasured up all these things and pondered them in her heart. The shepherds returned, 
glorifying and praising God for all the things they had heard and seen, which were just as 
they had been told." - Luke 2:16-20 

Our Lesson for Today:
Have you caught the bug? I hope you have! ! ! ~ You are probably thinking,
"Has this guy gone over the edge?" Well let me explain:

The Good News about Jesus is contagious. The shepherds didn't waste any 
time, as soon as the angels left, they hurried off to find Mary and the baby. 
They were interested in seeing for themselves what they had been told. As 
soon as they had saw the Christ child, they immediately broadcast what they 
had heard and seen.

There is nothing wrong with checking out things you have been told. Remember
Christianity does not say, "Close your eyes and believe," but rather, "Check it 
out yourself ."

The Bible encourages us to investigate its claims thoroughly (Jn. 1:46; 21:24 
Acts 17:11, 12), because your conclusion about Jesus is a life-and-death matter.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord, I thank you for the birth of a Savior, who was willing to come 
down from Your Kingdom to pay the price for my sins. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For to us a child is born, to us a son is given, and the government will be on his shoulders. And he will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace. - Isaiah 9:6
reflection: In a time of great darkness, God promised to send a light who would shine on everyone living in the shadow of death. He is both, "Wonderful Counselor" and "Mighty God." This message of hope was fulfilled in the birth of Christ and the establishment of His eternal Kingdom. ~ He came to deliver all people from their slavery, to sin.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for bringing the Light of the Gospel. Amen.

verse: Simenon took him in his arms and praised God, saying: Sovereign Lord, as you have promised, you may now dismiss your servant in peace. reflection: Simenon's watchfulness, and his discernment of the Messiah's presence, and his prophetic utterance were all the results of the Spirit's action ~ OR if you will "God's hand in the salvation of the whole world. prayer: Dear Lord of mercy and love my prayer is that I one day would be found faithful like Simenon. Amen.

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest. - Matthew 11:28
reflection: rest ~ the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding and guards our hearts and minds in Christ Jesus (Philippians 4:7). Here there are two parts. the 'labor' and the burden signify the contrition, anxiety, and terrors of sin, and death. To 'come to' Christ is to believe that sins are forgiven for Christ's sake. When we believe, our hearts are brought to life by the Holy Spirit through Christ's Word. ~ So here are these two chief parts: contrition and faith. A relationship with God changes meaningless, wearisome toil into spiritual productivity and purpose.
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me of my sins, known and unknown, so that I may have a meaningful relationship with You. Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I have told you these things, so that in me you may have peace. In this world you will have trouble. But take heart! I have overcome the world. - John 16:33
reflection: With these words Jesus told His disciples to take courage. In spite of the inevitable struggles they would face, they would not be alone. Jesus does not abandon us to our struggles either. If we remember that the ultimate victory has already been won, we can claim the peace of Christ in the most troublesome times.
prayer: Dear Lord I thank You for the victory that is mine by faith in You. Amen.

verse: He knowth the way that I take, When He hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold. - Job. 23:10
reflection: God understands each burden that you bear, He knows the trials of each day, and sympathizing, lends an ear to hear you even before you pray. He walks with those who trust His love, He holds them by the hand to guide, what need is there to fear or be dismayed, with His dear presence by your side.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You, that You know my every need and that Your love is so great that you will never leave me or forsake me. Amen.

No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: So from now on we regard no one from a worldly point of view. Though we once regarded Christ in this way, we do so no longer. 17 Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come: The old has gone, the new is here! 2 Corinthians 5:16-17
reflection: Separation from the world involves more than keeping our distance from sinners; it means staying close to God. ~ It involves more than avoiding worldly entertainment; ~ it extends to how we spend our time and money. There is no way to separate ourselves totally from all sinful influences. BUT we are to resist the sin around us, without giving up or giving in. (A New Years Resolution) Let us make a clean break with our past and give ourselves to God.
prayer: Dear Lord I have failed miserably this past year, help me to become a better person this new year. Amen.
original_content:
01/01/2011~~~food for thought~~~THERE IS ALWAYS ROOM FOR IMPROVEMENT

Our Bible Verse for Today:
16 So from now on we regard no one from a worldly point of view. 
Though we once regarded Christ in this way, we do so no longer. 
17 Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, the new creation has come:
The old has gone, the new is here! 2 Corinthians 5:16-17 

Our Lesson for Today:
Separation from the world involves more than keeping our distance from
sinners; it means staying close to God. ~ It involves more than avoiding 
worldly entertainment; ~ it extends to how we spend our time and money.

There is no way to separate ourselves totally from all sinful influences. BUT
we are to resist the sin around us, without giving up or giving in.

(A New Years Resolution)
Let us make a clean break with our past and give ourselves to God.

Prayer Suggestion:
Dear Lord I have failed miserably this past year,
help me to become a better person this new year. Amen.

Pastor Alvin & Marcie Sather

The Lord said, "I am the way, the truth, and the life. 
No one can come to the Father except through Me." ~ John: 14:6
